item.title: Johansen's shootout goal leads Blue Jackets over Hurricanes 4-3, hold onto playoff position
item.description:
RALEIGH, N.C. - Ryan Johansen had the only goal in the shootout, giving the Columbus Blue Jackets a 4-3 win over the Carolina Hurricanes on Tuesday night.
Scott Hartnell had two goals while Rene Bourque added the other for the Blue Jackets. A...

item.title: Eric Tangradi scores in overtime as Bulldogs edge Flames 2-1
item.description:
GLEN FALLS, N.Y. - Eric Tangradi scored the winner 4:47 into overtime and Joey McDonald made 39 saves as the Hamilton Bulldogs edged the host Adirondack Flames 2-1 on Tuesday in American Hockey League action.
Charles Hudon opened the scoring ...

item.title: OHL Roundup: Crouse, Bennett lead Frontenacs to fourth straight win
item.description:
PETERBOROUGH, Ont. - Lawson Crouse and Sam Bennett combined for seven points Tuesday night as the Kingston Frontenacs toppled the Peterborough Petes 6-2 in Ontario Hockey League action.

item.title: QMJHL Roundup: Cataractes pick up fourth straight win with victory over Remparts
item.description: SHAWINIGAN, Que. - Dylan Labbe's 15th goal of the season stood up as the eventual winner as the Shawinigan Cataractes extended their win streak to four games with a 2-1 victory over the Quebec Remparts on Tuesday night in Quebec Major Junior Hoc...

item.title: Nash snaps tie in 3rd; Rangers top Islanders in final regular-season visit to Nassau Coliseum
item.description:
UNIONDALE, N.Y. - Rick Nash scored a deflected goal to break a tie 2:50 into the third period, and the New York Rangers beat the New York Islanders in their last regular-season visit to Nassau Coliseum 2-1 on Tuesday night.
After dropping the...

item.title: Fiddler scores winning goal in Dallas Stars 2-1 victory over free-falling Philadelphia Flyers
item.description:
PHILADELPHIA - Vernon Fiddler scored the go-ahead goal late in the third period to lift the Dallas Stars to a 2-1 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers on Tuesday night.
Brett Ritchie also scored for the Stars, who won for just the fourth time...

item.title: Lamoriello not behind Devils bench against Wild
item.description:
Lou Lamoriello is not on the bench for the New Jersey Devils on Tuesday against the Minnesota Wild, instead watching the game from the press box.
Lamoriello has been behind the bench as a co-coach with Adam Oates and Scott Stevens since Peter D...

item.title: Islanders top-line forward Kyle Okposo returns to lineup vs. Rangers following eye surgery
item.description:
UNIONDALE, N.Y. - Top-line forward Kyle Okposo was back in the New York Islanders' lineup Tuesday night for a key matchup against the New York Rangers after missing 22 games following emergency surgery to fix a detached retina.

item.title: Blues agree to terms with defenseman Parayko
item.description:
ST. LOUIS – St. Louis Blues President of Hockey Operations and General Manager Doug Armstrong announced today the club has agreed to terms on a two-year entry level contract with defenseman Colton Parayko.

item.title: Avalanche goaltender Semyon Varlamov will sit out against Kings on Tuesday with groin ailment
item.description:
DENVER - The Colorado Avalanche will sit goaltender Semyon Varlamov on Tuesday night against Los Angeles after he injured his groin over the weekend.

item.description: TORONTO - Olli Jokinen felt like he took a "punch in the stomach" when he heard he'd been traded from the first-place Nashville Predators to the Toronto Maple Leafs. Jokinen could say that with some relief because he's back on a contender with t...

item.title: Rangers agree to terms with Tambellini on contract
item.description:
The New York Rangers agreed to terms Tuesday with forward Adam Tambellini on an entry-level contract, the team announced. Terms were not disclosed.
Tambellini was selected by the Rangers in the third round (No. 65) of the 2013 NHL Draft.
Ta...

item.title: Flyers sign forward Martel to entry-level contract
item.description:
The Philadelphia Flyers have signed 5-8, 162-lb C Danick Martel to a three-year entry-level contract, according to general manager Ron Hextall.
Martel, 20 (12/12/1994), is currently in his fourth and final season with the Blainville-Boisbriand ...

item.title: Stars sign forward Shore to entry-level contract
item.description:
Dallas Stars General Manager Jim Nill announced today that the club has signed center Devin Shore to a three-year entry-level contract. Per club policy, terms of the deal were not disclosed.

item.description: TORONTO – Samsung Canada and the National Hockey League today announced a multi-year partnership, making the global leader in innovative technology the first-ever exclusive partner in the mobile, tablet, and wearable hardware category. The partner...

item.title: Predators snap 6-game skid, top Coyotes 2-1 in overtime on Neal's goal
item.description:
GLENDALE, Ariz. - James Neal put in a rebound of Seth Jones' shot 2:45 into overtime to give the Nashville Predators a 2-1 victory over the Arizona Coyotes that snapped a season-worst, six-game skid on Monday night.
Pekka Rinne made 27 saves ...

item.title: Niemi makes 39 saves, stops 7 of 8 in shootout to lead Sharks past Penguins 2-1
item.description:
SAN JOSE, Calif. - Antti Niemi made 39 saves and stopped seven of eight shootout attempts to lead the San Jose Sharks to their 10th straight home win against the Pittsburgh Penguins, 2-1 on Monday night.

item.title: Vancouver Canucks hold on to defeat Anaheim Ducks 2-1
item.description:
VANCOUVER - Zack Kassian scored the winner in the third period Monday as Vancouver Canucks defeated the Anaheim Ducks 2-1.
Bo Horvat had the other goal for Vancouver (38-24-4), while Eddie Lack stopped 29 shots as the Canucks beat the Ducks i...

item.title: Monday's NHL Capsules
item.description:

item.title: Tavares scores overtime winner as Leafs blow lead, lose to Islanders
item.description:

item.title: Sheahan nets go-ahead goal, Howard makes 36 saves in Red Wings' 5-2 win over Oilers
item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Maple Leafs defenceman Polak undergoing hernia surgery, done for season
item.description:
TORONTO - Toronto Maple Leafs defenceman Roman Polak will have season-ending hernia surgery.
Polak, acquired last off-season from the St. Louis Blues, was a key shutdown player for the Leafs and had five goals and four assists in 56 games. ...

item.title: Panthers' Luongo skates, aiming for Thursday return
item.description:
Florida Panthers goaltender Roberto Luongo was on the ice Monday for the first time since he injured his shoulder during a game against the Toronto Maple Leafs on March 3, according to the Miami Herald.

item.title: Maple Leafs' Polak to miss remainder of season
item.description: The Toronto Maple Leafs announced today that defenceman Roman Polak will undergo season-ending hernia surgery. Polak had registered nine points in 56 games with Toronto this season. As a result, the club has recalled defenceman Petter Granberg fro...

item.title: Hudler, Varlamov and Talbot capture NHL's three stars of the week
item.description:
NEW YORK, - Calgary Flames centre Jiri Hudler was named the NHL's first star of the week Monday.
Hudler had four goals and four assists to help Calgary earn seven of a possible eight points. He leads the Flames with 23 goals and 33 assists in...

item.title: Hudler, Varlamov and Talbot named stars of week
item.description:
NEW YORK – Calgary Flames center Jiri Hudler, Colorado Avalanche goaltender Semyon Varlamov and New York Rangers goaltender Cam Talbot have been named the NHL's "Three Stars" for the week ending March 8.

item.title: Leafs' Kadri a healthy scratch versus Islanders after missing team meeting
item.description:
TORONTO - Centre Nazem Kadri will be a healthy scratch Monday night when the Toronto Maple Leafs host the New York Islanders.
The move is punishment for Kadri missing a team meeting Sunday morning.

item.title: Brassard scored in overtime, Talbot makes 29 saves in Rangers' 1-0 victory over Blackhawks
item.description:

item.title: Senators give up four-goal lead in third, hold on to win 5-4 in shootout
item.description:

item.title: Varlamov stops 29 shots as Avalanche beat Wild 3-2 for third straight win
item.description:
ST. PAUL, Minn. - Semyon Varlamov stopped 29 shots, Zach Redmond had a goal and an assist, and the Colorado Avalanche beat the Minnesota Wild 3-2 on Sunday night.
Cody McLeod and Gabriel Landeskog also scored for Colorado, which won its third...

item.title: Gibson makes 34 saves as Marlies keep pace in push for playoff spot
item.description:

item.title: NHL Capsules
item.description:
